metadata.title: Implement Patients List/Create API with Search and Pagination

context.background: This task implements Implement Patients List/Create API with Search and Pagination for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Follow the PRD architecture/security conventions and keep outputs compatible with the Healio design system and response envelopes.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Implement Patients List/Create API with Search and Pagination in the planned files (healio/app/api/v1/patients/route.ts, healio/services/patientService.ts, healio/schemas/patient.ts) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/patients, POST /api/v1/patients) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Add or update focused tests (unit/integration) for critical business rules, idempotency, or security behavior introduced by this task.
Document assumptions and any follow-on schema/API contracts in code comments or lightweight docs when they affect downstream tasks.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/patients, POST /api/v1/patients and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Validate security/tenant behavior with at least one negative test or rejection scenario when applicable.
Record evidence of persistence/side effects (DB row change, log entry, webhook event handling, cache behavior, etc.) as applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Implement Patients List/Create API with Search and Pagination is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 3 API Endpoints) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
Business rules, tenant scoping, and security constraints relevant to this task are enforced (validation, idempotency, RBAC, webhook/cron protection, etc.).
At least one verification artifact (test case, curl call, or fixture-driven check) proves the new behavior works and regressions are covered.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patients-route.test.ts
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented protected patients list/create API route with pagination and search query validation, standard success/error envelopes, and middleware auth-header enforcement. Added patient schemas plus patientService in-memory clinic-scoped patient records with encrypted-at-rest sensitive fields (phone/allergies/chronicConditions/currentMedications/dateOfBirth) using the existing AES helpers and a deterministic dev/test key for local in-memory storage. Added route tests covering POST create, GET list pagination/search, unauthenticated request rejection, invalid query, and clinic scope mismatch.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Changed files: healio/app/api/v1/patients/route.ts, healio/services/patientService.ts, healio/schemas/patient.ts, healio/tests/unit/patients-route.test.ts, plus generated healio/tsconfig.tsbuildinfo.

Endpoint verification via route tests: `node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patients-route.test.ts` passed; covers POST /api/v1/patients (201), GET /api/v1/patients pagination/search (200), unauthenticated GET (401), invalid page query (400), and POST clinic scope mismatch (403).

Persistence/side-effect evidence: patientService stores clinic-scoped patient records in a global in-memory store for dev/test and decrypts sensitive fields on API output while keeping encrypted payloads at rest in the store.
Implementation commit: c368e33 (feat(healio-patients): patients list create route).
